result.execSummary:
The defendant Marqual Quashawn Henley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)4.
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge, payable from defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC). Remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Cash bail in case 20CF3563 will apply.
Court waived costs/fees due to indigency.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain GED or HSED.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment or full-time enrollment in school, or combination of both.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marqual Quashawn Henley

records.addlTxt: -received, filed, and distributed. Defense received a copy.

Defendant Marqual Quashawn Henley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Aneeq Ahmad appeared by video for Marqual Quashawn Henley.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Court held colloquy with Defendant. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial NUNC PRO TUNC TO JULY 11, 2022. State filed original Information. Defense counsel waived reading of Information. Defendant previously entered a plea of Guilty on July 11, 2022.  

Defense addressed Defendant's program eligibility status. For reasons stated on the record, Court made no change to programming.  

Case forwarded to the Clerk's Office for processing. 

E-FILED: Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.
Received and Filed.

Attorney Aneeq Ahmad in Court, Defendant Marqual Quashawn Henley not in Court, in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Status hearing. Defense appeared via Zoom Video Conference. State appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Discussion placed on the record regarding Preliminary hearing / Information. Court proposed options to address this matter. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

**Clerk confirmed that Defendant was recently transferred to RCI.

Clerk contacted the parties via email to schedule Status hearing regarding Preliminary hearing/Information issue.
Status hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Associated with Charge #3
Associated with Charge #2
Associated with Charge #3

Defendant Marqual Henley in court with attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  Defendant Marqual Henley in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Case in Court for Sentencing hearing with Defendant's other case 20CF3563. Court reviewed Character Reference Letters and Sentencing Memorandum. State complied with Victim Notification. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. Additional Statements by: Iyonnah T. 

AS TO COUNT 2:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of FOUR (4) YEARS, Consecutive to case 20CF3563, with credit for 82 DAYS time served. 
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is TWO (2) YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWO (2) YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 3:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of FOUR (4) YEARS, Concurrent to COUNT 2. 
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is TWO (2) YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWO (2) YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 4:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of THREE (3) YEARS and SIX (6) MONTHS, Concurrent to COUNT 2 and COUNT 3.
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is ONE (1) YEAR and SIX (6) MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWO (2) YEARS.  

Court found Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Court found Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
- Obtain GED or HSED.
- AODA Assessment, comply with recommended treatment. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- Obtain/Maintain Full-Time Employment or Full-Time Enrollment in School, or combination of both.

Court ordered Defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of SIX (6) MONTHS, effective immediately. 

Court set Restitution at ZERO.

Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE and pay DNA SURCHARGE, payable from Defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC). Remainder to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. CASH BAIL FROM CASE 20CF3563 WILL APPLY.

Court WAIVED COSTS/FEES due to Indigency. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 
Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

FILED: PreTrial Incarceration Credit and Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Defense Sentencing Memo dated August 2, 2022; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Character Reference Letters on Behalf of Defendant; received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.
GLOBAL RESOLUTION

Defendant Marqual Henley in Court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  Defendant Marqual Henley in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for Status hearing. Defendant also has Case 20CF3563 scheduled today for Jury Trial. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a GLOBAL resolution. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. Court addressed Defendant's eligibility for Challenge Incarceration Program. 

AS TO COUNT 2, COUNT 3, AND COUNT 4: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor.
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing, Branch 46. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. STATE MUST FILE AN ORDER TO PRODUCE. 
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.

For reasons stated on the record, Defense requested $8,000.00 CASH BAIL be returned to the person who posted it. State did not object. Court GRANTED Defense request.
COURT ORDERED $8,000.00 CASH BAIL RETURNED TO THE PERSON WHO POSTED IT.
Case forwarded to the Clerk's Office for processing.

**JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE GRAYSON, BRANCH 16.**
Defendant Marqual Quashawn Henley in Court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  Defendant Marqual Quashawn Henley in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties are continuing negotiations. If the parties reach a GLOBAL RESOULTION, Branch 46 will accept Case 22CF382. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing in Branch 46. 
Status hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am. Status hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
STATE MUST FILE AN ORDER TO PRODUCE.

**JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE GRAYSON, BRANCH 16.**
Defendant Marqual Quashawn Henley in Court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad (appearing as a Friend of the Court) .  Defendant Marqual Quashawn Henley in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Ahmad represents Defendant in Case 20CF3563 pending in Branch 46. Attorney Ahmad expects to be retained on Case 22CF382; therefore, the Public Defender's Office did NOT attempt to appoint counsel for Defendant. 

State provided a new GLOBAL OFFER to Defense that includes all Counts in Case 20CF3563 (Branch 46) and Case 22CF382. If the parties reach a global resolution, Branch 46 will accept Case 22CF382. 

For reason stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing in Branch 46. 
Status hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am. Status hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 

STATE MUST FILE AN ORDER TO PRODUCE.

Attorney Thomas William Reed in court, defendant Marqual Quashawn Henley not in court, in custody.  Patrick T Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in the process of retaining Attorney Ahmad, case to be set over to Judge Feiss for Order to show cause hearing. Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Marqual Quashawn Henley not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter go before the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Aneeq Ahmad in court via zoom, defendant Marqual Quashawn Henley not in court, in custody. Attorney Thomas Reed also present in court via zoom. Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for State V. Lee Hearing. Defendant not produced. Attorney Reed provides an update to the court. Court is advised that the defendant is being represented by Attorney Ahmad in his other matters, and may be subject to appointment of counsel at county expense by the SPD office. Court finds cause to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marqual Quashawn Henley in court, in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for a State V-LEE hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marqual Quashawn Henley in court, in custody Prior to the case being called on the record.   Attorney Thomas Reed appeared from the Public Defender's Office.  Patricia Daugherty for Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for order to show cause hearing.  The matter was held via zoom.  Mr. Henley was on zoom from Dodge for over an hour, but had to disconnect because the time in the booth was only booked for 30 minutes.
Attorney Thomas Reed indicated that Henley has other open matters where he is represented by Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  PDs office did reach out to Attorney Ahmad to see if he was being retained on this case as well, but they have not received a definitive response.  Attorney Ahmad told SPD he would talk to the family to see if they were going to retain him.  SPD is still waiting on an answer.
Attorney Thomas Reed thinks they need about 2 to 3 weeks to resolve this issue and for counsel to be assigned to Mr Henleys case if Attorney Ahmad is not retained.  Parties agree to schedule matter in prelim court.  The clerk did reach out to Dodge via email providing the new court date and time. The court order the matter adjourned to Prelim court for the preliminary hearing.

 

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Case scheduled for an Order to Show Cause Hearing. Defendant moved from Milwaukee County custody to Dodge Correctional, unable to appear via video for today's hearing. Case rescheduled for an Order to Show Cause Hearing via ZOOM on 4/28/22 at 9:30 AM in Branch 16. Tom Reed of SPD's office, and ADA Franken notified via e-mail. Defendant scheduled to appear from Dodge Correctional via ZOOM.

Defendant Marqual Quashawn Henley not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST. Case set for Preliminary hearing. Public Defender's office request additional time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State v. Lee Hearing. Case adjourned, Branch 16.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant previously posted $8,000.00; therefore, Defendant must post an additional $42,000.00 for a GRAND TOTAL OF $50,000.00. 
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.

JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE GRAYSON, BRANCH 16. 
Defendant Marqual Quashawn Henley in Court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  Daniel T Flaherty and Patrick T Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Initial Appearance. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Discussion placed on the record. Defendant also has three cases (20CF3563, 20CF3957, and 21CF1154) pending in Branch 46. Defendant is advised that Case 22CF382 is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defense counsel and Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint. Court advised Defendant of maximum penalties, right to counsel, and right to a Preliminary hearing. Court reviewed Criminal Complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant has THREE Cases [20CF3563, 20CF3957, and 21CF1154] pending in Branch 46. Cases are scheduled today (January 31, 2022) at 03:30 pm in Branch 46. 
State requested Judge Feiss do the Initial Appearance on Case 22CF382.
Initial Appearance scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/17/22 @ 1p
